newsitem.title: USA: Worldtex shares jump after Q3 earnings.
newsitem.headline: Worldtex shares jump after Q3 earnings.

text.p: Shares of Worldtex Inc leapt on Tuesday after it posted strong third quarter earnings and predicted 1996 earnings would equal or exceed analysts' estimates of $0.70 to $0.75 a share.

Shares jumped about seven percent, up 1/2 to 8-1/4 and touched a new year high of 8-3/8 after the third-quarter earnings of $0.17 a share, compared with $0.03 a share in the year-ago quarter, including charges.

Worldtex makes nylon and cotton covered spandex used in panty hose. It said several factors contributed to the strong quarterly profits, including an expansion in end-use applications which increased sales despite lackluster European market conditions.

It said its low cost Bogota, Colombia, manufacturing facility added to operating margins and said North American sales and profits grew during the quarter, posting a turnaround from the declines of the past few quarters.
